definition: back to where we were (idiom); absolutely no improvement/Things haven't changed at all.
to become reconciled/on good terms with each other
a shattered mirror put back together (idiom)/(of marriage) to pick up the pieces and start anew/for a separated couple to reconcile and reunite
sky clears after rain/new hopes after a disastrous period (idiom)/every cloud has a silver lining (idiom)/see also 雨過天青|雨过天青[yu3 guo4 tian1 qing1]
to become more resolute with the passing of time (idiom)
The issue is in the past, and the situation has changed (idiom)./It is water under the bridge.
